column4: don't know, just ever since the upgrade to lucid all my drives whether they have labels or not are being mounted via UUID
dont know how to fix offhand. something new they added
i figured, just sick of disks mounting as /media/UUID instead of /media/disk or /media/label
you install or cd boot?
full install should show you the lable, but the liveCD shows you /media/asbe98skjhsd87
i have determined that /dev/disk/by-label isn't being generated
full install
hrm odd. i know off the cd or frugal install, it mounts them like that, but after install it mounts my ntfs drives by lable
did you look at the disk in disk manager, just to double check it has a lable?
nope, if it isn't being generated by udev in /dev/disk what would the point be? :)
ah. might have something to do with upgrading versus an install and import
updates work fine, by i try to stick away from revision upgrades. some reason they dont always go as planned and give problems i can never figure out.
i thought that...i know at least on intrepid live cd (which is the last disc i burned live cd wise) it will mount properly
heh i know what you mean but i've always been able to fix any quirks that crop up....been dist upgrading since breezy
hey figure this out, insert a dvd that has a label and it works
plug up a usb stick or external drive with labels and it chokes and falls back to UUID
that is odd
you're telling me
if automount, assume fs=iso9660 lol
almost seems like its a udev rule, which i can't recall if i'm missing rules or not
yeah really
cant say there, ive never had much reason to set rules for udev on my own pc's
i've had a few occasions i needed to...but i meant i can't recall whethere i had more than 4 rules which i think back a few dist updgrades i did have a good number of them meaning they got nuked
